Package au.edu.sydney.hecfor.erp.tgr

Class TGRFacadeImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.sydney.hecfor.erp.tgr.TGRFacadeImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TGRFacade
    public class TGRFacadeImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements TGRFacade
    Default implementation of the TGRFacade interface.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TGRFacadeImpl()
      This is just the default constructor - you may rely on it being present in the module you test.

      Preconditions:
      None
      Postconditions:
      Note that this does NOT inject a product provider, the initial state is with this provider being null.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Product addProduct​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String manufacturer)
      Adds a new product to the system.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      A new Product with the given information will be present in the system.
      int addStorage​(java.lang.Integer storageID, int productID, int count, java.lang.String location)
      Adds a stored amount of the given product

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      An amount of the given product will be stored with the provided details.
      void assignApprovalStatus​(int productID, java.lang.String approvalStatus)
      Sets a Product to an approval status.
      java.util.List<Product> getAllProducts()
      Returns a list of all current products.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      None

      Gets the count of the given storage.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      None

      Gets the location of the given storage.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      None
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStorages()
      Returns a list of all current product storage.

      Preconditions:
      None
      Postconditions:
      None
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getStorages​(int productID)
      Returns a list of all current storage matching the given product.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      None
      void modifyStorageCount​(int id, int modifier)
      Modifies the count of the given storage.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      The selected storage count will reflect the modification.
      void setProductProvider​(ProductList provider)
      Injects a product module provider to the system

      Preconditions:
      None
      Postconditions:
      The system will call the given provider for all product related operations
      All storages will be cleared, and the null ID state for new storages will be reset.
      void setStorageCount​(int id, int count)
      Sets the count of the given storage.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      The selected storage count will reflect the new value.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> viewAllProducts()
      Returns a list of all current product represented by "Manufacturer: Name"

      Preconditions:
      None
      Postconditions:
      None

      • addProduct

        public Product addProduct​(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String manufacturer)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Adds a new product to the system.

        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        Postconditions:
        A new Product with the given information will be present in the system.
        Specified by:
        addProduct in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        name - The product name. May not be null or empty.
        manufacturer - The manufacturer. May not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        The Product that has been added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any argument requirements are breached

      • assignApprovalStatus

        public void assignApprovalStatus​(int productID,
                                 java.lang.String approvalStatus)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Sets a Product to an approval status. Can be a step on an approval process or a final outcome.

        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        Postconditions:
        The matching product will be set to the given approval status.
        Specified by:
        assignApprovalStatus in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        productID - The product to assign. Must be positive (may not be zero).
        approvalStatus - The approval status to assign. Must be one of the following: "LAB TESTING", "CLINICAL TRIALS", "APPROVED", "REJECTED".
        If the status is "APPROVED" or "REJECTED" the approval is considered finalised.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider. If the given (valid) product ID does not match a product that does not have finalised approval in the current product provider.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the argument requirements are breached.

      • viewAllProducts

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> viewAllProducts()
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Returns a list of all current product represented by "Manufacturer: Name"

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        None
        Specified by:
        viewAllProducts in interface TGRFacade
        Returns:
        A list of all current products represented by "Manufacturer: Name". In the case no products can be found, returns an empty list.

      • addStorage

        public int addStorage​(java.lang.Integer storageID,
                      int productID,
                      int count,
                      java.lang.String location)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Adds a stored amount of the given product

        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        Postconditions:
        An amount of the given product will be stored with the provided details.
        Specified by:
        addStorage in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        storageID - The storage ID must be unique, may not be negative, may not be zero. The storage ID may be null, in which case a generated unique ID will be used. This is only available so long as all previous storage IDs have been null - if an ID is provided, all future calls must also provide a unique ID.
        productID - The product to store. Must be positive (may not be zero).
        count - The amount of the product to store. Must be positive (may be zero).
        location - The location of the storage. May not be empty or null.
        Returns:
        The id of the created storage.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider. If the given (valid) product ID does not match a product in the current product provider.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the argument requirements are breached.

      • getStorages

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStorages()
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Returns a list of all current product storage.

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        None
        Specified by:
        getStorages in interface TGRFacade
        Returns:
        A list of all current storage represented by "ProductID-StorageID: count (location)". In the case no storage can be found, returns an empty list.

      • getStorages

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getStorages​(int productID)
                                              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Returns a list of all current storage matching the given product.

        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        Postconditions:
        None
        Specified by:
        getStorages in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        productID - The product to match. Must be positive (may not be zero).
        Returns:
        A list of all current storage IDs matching the given product. In the case no storage can be found, returns an empty list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider. If the given (valid) product ID does not match a product in the current product provider.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the argument requirements are breached.

        Returns:

      • setStorageCount

        public void setStorageCount​(int id,
                            int count)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Sets the count of the given storage.

        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        Postconditions:
        The selected storage count will reflect the new value.
        Specified by:
        setStorageCount in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        id - The storage id to modify. Must be positive, may not be zero.
        count - The new count of product in the given storage. May not be negative, may be zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider. If the given (valid) storage ID does not match a known storage
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the argument requirements are breached.

      • modifyStorageCount

        public void modifyStorageCount​(int id,
                               int modifier)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                               java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Modifies the count of the given storage.

        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        Postconditions:
        The selected storage count will reflect the modification.
        Specified by:
        modifyStorageCount in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        id - The storage id to modify. Must be positive, may not be zero.
        modifier - The modification to be made. May be a positive or negative number. May not reduce the final count below zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider. If the given (valid) storage ID does not match a known storage.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the argument requirements are breached.

      • setProductProvider

        public void setProductProvider​(ProductList provider)
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Injects a product module provider to the system

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        The system will call the given provider for all product related operations
        All storages will be cleared, and the null ID state for new storages will be reset.
        Specified by:
        setProductProvider in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        provider - The provider to inject. May be null, however this will result in some product related operations throwing exceptions.
